review_body: Inferior to the mobile website I look at imgur for images not for comments. If I want comments I‚Äôll look at reddit. The problem with the mobile app is that each post is cluttered with other annoying and unwanted information such as comments, links, and tags and there is an unwanted toolbar persistent at the bottom of the screen. The result is that only 50% of the screen is dedicated to the actual image. Also, on the website, if you click the ‚Äòview more‚Äô button, it expands the the additional posts inline. The app takes you to a different page, requiring going back and forth a lot. Personally I hate this and much prefer the contiguous browsing experience of the website.

It gets worse every time Let me first correct the description: Imgur is not the easiest way to discover spicy memes.  There is a fresh batch of spambot posts every minute.  Your phone is about to get slower, hotter, and most definitely less funny.

They don‚Äôt care about the community The Imgur Devs seem to pride themselves on having at least decent interactions with their community in the past. There was a kind of trust that the devs wouldn‚Äôt do anything to drastic to sellout the users. For example, around a year ago they made a promise that they would never have intrusive advertisements, only banner ads. Well they have either forgotten their promises or have decided that they don‚Äôt care about the users anymore, since ads will now show up in the middle of posts. I understand that companies that provide a product for ‚Äúfree‚Äù need to make revenue somehow, but this is too far. Making ads in intrusive places where people can accidentally click on them, (yes we know it‚Äôs on purpose), will turn users away. Not to mention all the malware and dangerous ads that can appear both on the app and website. I‚Äôve been on Imgur since basically the beginning, and it has gone from a small company that I adored to just another sellout.
Back In My Day... Dear Reader,

Great and (at times) Enlightening Time-waster This community is fantastic, even the trolls make you laugh at times. If you have yet to experience Imgur, please do yourself a favor and try it out.... sometimes it can take a couple of days to get hooked and see the beauty of this community. It‚Äôs five star hands down.

Ads have killed the app. Stay away This didn‚Äôt have ads for the longest time and it was great. As soon as they added them in battery performance plummeted. Like going from 20-30% of daily battery usage to 60%+ with no change in settings. Ads at the bottom of posts or comments weren‚Äôt always seen and could usually be ignored. They moved to ads being injected into the middle of the post, but could still be ignored for the most part and posters would work around them.

Baffling lack of basic functionality As a standalone app, I‚Äôm sure Imgur works fine, but attempting to open a high-resolution image that you found through another service seems to actually be impossible. I found a reddit post with an image I‚Äôd like as a wallpaper for my phone. Some users recommended setting the imgur website to desktop mode for a high-res version, but that option has apparently been removed from the web version. Hitting the ‚Äúopen in app‚Äù button simply opens the apple store, trying to save the image to my account just tells me that the browser version has been discontinued, and searching the exact title of the image returns no results. Even with the exact imgur URL for the image, there is no way to access it through the app. This should be a simple process. The ‚ÄúOpen in App‚Äù button should just open the image, but it somehow fails to do even that.

The ads....SOOOO many ads. I‚Äôm fine with the intermittent ads shuffled between multiple gifs on the same post. I‚Äôm fine with the full page ads between posts. The browser redirect ads though are beyond annoying. I tried to address the issue with support because those ads are SUPPOSED to be in violation of Imgur‚Äôs policy. Since reporting, it seems as though the amount of these invasive ads has grown exponentially. Every three to five posts and I have to close the App Store popup, then close Safari, and only then can I return to browsing in this poorly maintained, under managed app. I‚Äôd suggest avoiding this app if you value your sanity and the security of your phone.

Fun, was there since years ago but need some changes I was there in the beginning when imgur was getting started and have seen everything develop quite nicely. It is a fun community I think many would enjoy, if you haven‚Äôt yet give it a try!

I love Imgur but... Tbh I love using Imgur to save photos in my own albums etc., but the only thing I was kind of dissatisfied with was when I guess every time I exceed the number of images in an album, it‚Äôll most of the time rearrange my photos in the album by itself even when I chose not to rearrange my photos that way. If possible, I hope there‚Äôll be a solution for this. And also for every time I put a link or something in the description part of the photos, when I refresh the page, the link will appear to be broken and not together. I hope that'll be fixed soon as well. I still love Imgur though!

Do you like to spend forever in the bathroom I‚Äôve used this app for many years and it has caused several family members to wonder if I had some sort of health issues based on the sheer amount of time I will spend on the toilet. This app has literally made people think I have severe stomach problems... but totally worth it... the community is pretty cool, pics are funny, plenty of inside jokes and references. Out of all the image sharing sites this is my favorite one. If you‚Äôre on there find me lahdidahdi or find me in Facebook Lea jones in Hollywood üòä

Nuff said It‚Äôs an app that I‚Äôve had for a long time, through all the updates and random changes. I‚Äôve been here since the beginning idea of folders, the pleas and after years the final hurrah of getting them. This app is addictive, strangely not in a bad way, and because it‚Äôs very easy to understand I can find things extremely easy. And it‚Äôs interactive. I LOVE how interactive it is. I wish the ‚Äúdid you miss the day before?‚Äù Option would come back, I loved clicking and going back to the posts I missed the day before. But it‚Äôs super amazing

So trendy it hurts So you want to belong to a lifeless flaming community? You‚Äôve came to the right place:) this app is just as bad as everything everyone talks about....nothing original but reposted garbage and wannabe witty comments that how dare you comment or try to make sense or you will get flamed.

It‚Äôs Getting Worse Imgur used to be great. The community was way less toxic than other meme-based platforms, and it felt like the owners of the website actually cared about users. Now, it‚Äôs safe to say that neither of those are really true anymore.

Currently petitioning Apple to pull the app from the store. Full of adware and spyware bits. This app used to be amazing but then they desired to do adds on pages .At first I wasn‚Äôt happy about the sponsored posts but whatever I could skip them. Then they put adds at the bottom of image posts that you could accidentally click on and they were full of virus links. Then they put adds in the middle of long posts and NEVER made sure the adds were safe. Literally every add is a scam ware add. That was the final straw imgur. Until you fix your mess up here I‚Äôm done with you and will always browse with a adblocker so that you don‚Äôt get any money from me. I hate to do this but you gave us no choice.

Truly disappointed. The ads are getting ridiculous. I get that they need to make money and I have no problems with that but the ads are just getting more and more invasive. First, they just popped up below the posts. After that, they popped up between images in longer posts and comments. That second one is where it started getting bad. They‚Äôd redirect me from imgur even when I didn‚Äôt tap them and the app would cause my phone to heat up and lose battery life. Once they fixed those issues, they started putting ads between posts on top of all of the other ad placements. Now, they‚Äôve added new ads that play sound without being tapped and the old malicious ads are back again. I love imgur and its community but the app is so loaded with malicious ads, I‚Äôm uninstalling it.

Great App has a few problems though. Minor but great. Honestly. Used to love the app. It seemed like a good alternative to FBs drama and IG‚Äôs fakeness but I‚Äôll tell you this. It‚Äôs all a lie. It‚Äôs like reddit combined with FB, IG and Twitter but worse. People can spam images and basically farm points like there‚Äôs not tomorrow. I‚Äôve been on a year and got 13,000 points. Roughly 300 comments and 10 images the entire time I‚Äôm on. Guy joins 3 months and posts 20 images a day and farms 64,000 points.

The ads are done so poorly I think everything understands that imgur stays running due to ad revenue. What I don‚Äôt understand is how they can possibly think that the way that the implementation of the ads is done is in any way acceptable. The app has gone downhill and now have an atrocious user experience with overly intrusive ads that are terribly placed and prevent seamless navigation through posts. Half the time you can‚Äôt even scroll to the next page without so much as grazing an ad and if that occurs say goodbye to viewing what you were attempting to look at. Instead you get taken to a page for whatever junk they decided to plaster every page with. This app has just really gone downhill.
Heat issue, ad problems I really love Imgur as a community, and I enjoy the content it provides.  But it‚Äôs only enjoyable if you can access the content, which I no longer can.

Horrible Ad Placement I‚Äôve been using the mobile app since launch. I enjoy the imgur community and it‚Äôs posted content even though it has become more and more tame in the last years. I saw the app icon change, UI changes, and the creation of favorites folders. When ads started to pop up, I figured ‚ÄúThey gotta make that bread‚Äù so I thought nothing of it. An ad at the end of a post or in between posts was fine. Now, the ad is fixed at the bottom of the app‚Äôs UI and cuts off a far amount of screen real-estate. This is more of a personal problem because I have a iPhone 7 but I still prefer this size of screen and phone. I wish the adds would revert back to what they were before.

It's pretty good, but still has problems It is really good if you need something to waste your time. Though the community is weird and can be really toxic, the general experience tends to be quite positive, interesting, and enjoyable.

Won‚Äôt allow me to upload This is not user error, as I used to be able to upload pictures without problem. Whenever I try and upload an image it says ‚Äúinvalid captcha‚Äù and will not allow me to proceed. The problem is THERE IS NO PLACE TO ENTER A CAPTCHA. No box with scrambled letters and an area to type. No boxes to click on to check off. Nothing. I have searched the entire app for at least 20 minutes and then looked it up and this is a common problem. This is just sad that an app this large can fail so badly and for so long (this has been a problem for me for months). I will adjust my review if this is fixed, but I doubt it will be.

Update is garbage I have been using Imgur for at least 5 years now. Back in 2013 it was amazing. But thanks to the new update that decided it would be a good idea to put ads in the middle of posts with more than 7 images. This update makes the app impossible to use after 30 minutes. Also a different ad reloads if you scroll back up through a post, which uses A LOT more memory & data than it used to. I don‚Äôt recommend downloading this app until they decide to at least make it more efficient. I understand ads are there to help pay bills, but this is interfering with the app performance.

Crude Society There should be a button that enables a user to delete rude comments from their posts. I‚Äôve received of nothing but hate while being on this app and I‚Äôm honestly sick of it. I‚Äôm only using it to upload photos of my own to copy the links of it and email or text or message through the internet for my friends, family, etc.

Doesn't respect notification preferences For some reason, imgur can't seem to figure out how to respect the notification preferences in the app, electing instead to spam users with whatever they feel should have your attention (read, what they're now promoting for profit).

This app makes me laugh. As a person who suffers from depression few things make me happy...even less laugh. I‚Äôve been using imgur for about 7 years. My battle is constant, but at least at the end of the day I can count on imgur to have a user friendly interface, little or no ads and fresh funny high quality content. Thanks fellow imgurians and the Imgur team for making the end of each day a little brighter.

Ads ruined the app The app has started to include increasingly intrusive ads to the point where now some ads will even full screen themselves on your phone and are difficult to close without clicking on them.

It‚Äôs ok Ehhh.... it‚Äôs alright I guess. I‚Äôve noticed it is very glitchy. Tagging is a nightmare, I just cut and paste through my notes. You need to stumble through it and make a lot of mistakes in the beginning. I am posting art and have noticed people just troll most of the feed. Some comments feel like mass bots as they don‚Äôt necessarily match the images, and as far as I can tell there is no way to delete comments. Pretty stupid you are the one building your page. I would go with Insta over this if you are creative, but if you are looking for entrainment and not necessarily building a following it‚Äôs worth a try.

Those ads though... As you browse imgur you will come across ads that won‚Äôt display correctly, which I‚Äôm ok with because who even purchases products based on ads these days. The real issue is Imgur‚Äôs inability to fix the problem when you accidentally click on one while scrolling and the ad sends your phone into a frenzy of trying to load an ad that won‚Äôt open. It‚Äôs just a never ending loading wheel that pops up every half a second until you close the app completely and then restart it. I even posted the issue on the app, if it weren‚Äôt for the teams blatant disregard for trying to fix it I would gladly leave a 5 star review.

Hmmm I love this app and the hilarity of the tagged #funny posts. The one problem I have the prevents 5 stars is that I will be many MANY posts into the funny category, will leave the app for as little as 5 seconds, and when I return to the app OT has restarted. I must start back at the beginning of the funny category and see ALL the posts I had previously seen or skipped. I have background app refresh on for this app specifically and that seems to do nothing to fix this issue. Please fix this!!!

Creative, even idiots can do it! It makes no difference how stupid you are this app has a place for you!   You want to be a mortician?   Come on in.  Somebody will find a way for ya to talk about where the embalming fluid goes.  Wanna be a crash dummy?   You too can find a crash dummy or two to give you some free advice about setting really still.  Come in, there is some crazy, sarcastic, weird, twisted, rap loving downugger here just for YOU!

New update is absolute rubbish I have been using imgur for 3 years and not a once have I complained about ads but now it‚Äôs getting ridiculous. They added ads at the bottom of posts as small banners and I said ‚Äúokay.‚Äù Then they added ads in between posts and I said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs fine I guess.‚Äù But now there are MULTIPLE ads INBETWEEN images of a post, to which I say ‚Äúare you kidding me!?‚Äù I don‚Äôt know if imgur is hurting for money right now but if they are, they need to come up with a better solution; this new update has essentially sucked the fun right out of the platform.

Ad Central Disappointments I‚Äôve been part of the imgur community for years and have thus far been very pleased with the app. However, recent advertising updates now have caused ads to be placed within actual posts themselves instead of on the sidelines. I understand the need for ads to provide funding, but the new placement is a violation of the posts we all come here for. I‚Äôm beyond disappointed with this choice and would not recommend supporting them until they re-evaluate their recent ad decisions. If you‚Äôre here for the content and not the advertisements, I would switch to a different platform to get your fix.

Good Community Terrible App The Imgur community is pretty exceptional. However, the iOS app has been terrible in my experience. I use an iPhone 7, and the app has been consistently bug and crash filled for months. It has always been buggy in general, but I can barely scroll through 3 posts without the app freezing. Recently the number of ads has skyrocketed as well, increasing bugginess. If I accidentally tap an ad, it will continue trying to load even after I close it and scroll to the next post. The app is unacceptable at this point.
Drains battery life in background Maybe my iPhone 6s is a bit out of date, but it‚Äôs getting very hot when running Imgur. The app uses a lot of battery, and often is laggy.

Ads and Battery Drain Used to love this app. It was always smooth and worked without issue. However, with the introduction of the obnoxious ads, the app has become unusable (and not just because I don't like ads). With the introduction of the ads, the app becomes more and more slow the more you use it - until it becomes unusable, forcing you to close it. With this slowness, your phone becomes increasingly more and more hot. With this hotness, your phone battery tanks. I can use up about 40% battery in 20 mins. The ads seriously need to be rolled back until the performance issues have been solved.

Mostly just angry trolls I uploaded a few pics on my old account that didn‚Äôt really have anything on it (4 years old maybe?) and immediately got hit with a barrage of downvoted and hate comments. The pics were innocent, nothing offensive in any way. The app itself is nice and rather easy to use, but this community is trash and most people on imgur (with a few exceptions of nice ppl) need to be loaded onto a rocket and shot directly into the sun or handed over to ISIS to be tortured. This is mainly a community of incels that are angry for no reason. If your an artist or content creator You‚Äôre better off finding another platform to share your images.

Terrible "admins" The mods are absolutely terrible, banning newer accounts for hardly anything, but protect accounts that are "renown" even though they partake in targeted harassment, sending users violent messages, etc. Extremely left leaning user base, that argues without facts. It's also turned into nothing but reposts with zero original content. If you don't want cancer, then avoid this website/app. I've already checked, and they won't cover my medical bills since my cancer diagnosis.

I LOVE IMGUR, but.. I am and have been a huge fan of Imgur, it always puts a smile on my face and i just enjoy the content. However, with the newer update and with how images are laid out now to scroll down through them? I am not a big fan of, it now looks like Tumblr or Reddit. It lost its touch where you‚Äôd just click on a photo and keep swiping. Take that as a positive critic that is lighthearted. I for one would love to have the older lay out back :) thank you.

No. Just no. The app is fine. But the people using this app are pathetic. They attack you for no reason and no they didn‚Äôt attack me but I watched it happen to other people. This girl posted about her weight loss recovery and overcoming obstacles and they verbally attack her with awful remarks. Not one person said something nice and I lost faith even more in humanity because of this. If this is your type of thing by all means join IMGUR. The apps fine and I had no problems with it. I can‚Äôt believe the disrespect and audacity of people hiding behind a screen insulting others. I‚Äôd like to see them speak their mind in person.

This is one of the best designed apps out there Not only is it intuitive to use this app. The Dev team works tirelessly to make it great! The more you spend time looking at funny gifs and pictures of cats, the more you realize there is an amazing community here. Lovely people, we are the imgurians, there are inside jokes and all sorts of traditions. Even the adds are pretty good. One of my all time favorite apps. Get on board, yo!
It‚Äôs just crazily overheating my device now Thanks for fixing login issues.

I love imgur I love imgur and use it very often! Its just something I enjoy to do as often as I can. Ive been on front page about 5 times now, and getting that notification that your own image has been liked by up to thousands of people gives a sense of satisfaction that is very hard to achieve on the internet. Definitely browse imgur, it holds some great stuff.

Will be erasing the app after this update The new updated added ads in between the photos in such a way as to intentionally make you press them by accident. I sincerely hope they fire whoever came up with this idea seeing as how their target audience  is millennials and ALL market research shows thatcher hate being directly marketed too. Way to do the opposite an alienate your core users morons!

Some more complaining about ads Look. Were not idiots. Well okay most of us are not so those who are not understand the purpose of the ads. Imgur needs the funds to keep the app and the company going. But for the love of the giraffe mascot can you lads and lasses please screen the ads before slapping them on into the app. Gonna have to organize flash mobs to annoy the imgur staff to the point they change their approach. Oh you wanted to use the bathroom jimmy who works at imgur? Sorry, an outside force is now causing you to go somewhere completely different to learn about vacation deals and you must now make doody in your pants.

Are we still allowed to post bikinis? Are we allowed to post pictures of Instagram models exercising in yoga pants or swimsuits? I tried both, and my posts were taken down swiftly. Eventually, when the 3rd post was removed, I was slapped with a permanent ban. And every time they took a post down, they linked the community rules which state ‚Äúno nudity or sexually explicit content,‚Äù and anything NSFW must be tagged mature. However, when I complain that my post did not violate the rules, they tell me to read it again or flat-out ignore me. The moderators are unaccountable and downright awful! And what‚Äôs the point of the mature tag? There isn‚Äôt one...

Better than the last version It‚Äôs a great way to kill time during work! I can pull it out when I get a notification, exhale through my nose,  and furrow my brow as I type up a clever comment or a roaring riposte and everyone in the meeting thinks I‚Äôm responding to a time sensitive e-mail instead. Also, you can now block/mute trolls, stalkers, and losers quite easily. A good app, solid 5 out of 7!

Great until latest update On iOS: One of my daily go to apps. However, with the recent update, after closing the app it continued doing something in the background that totally drained my battery in a couple of hours. Phone restart, battery charge, and it started right back doing it again. Heated my phone up causing Face ID to fail and refuse being reset until the ‚Äúphone cools down‚Äù was the alert. Uninstalled Imgur, restart, allowed to cool, and all is good again.

Great until latest update On iOS: One of my daily go to apps. However, with the recent update, after closing the app it continued doing something in the background that totally drained my battery in a couple of hours. Phone restart, battery charge, and it started right back doing it again. Heated my phone up causing Face ID to fail and refuse being reset until the ‚Äúphone cools down‚Äù was the alert. Uninstalled Imgur, restart, allowed to cool, and all is good again.

Just stay a lurker App is great, it‚Äôs funny and where I spend a lot of my free time. Community is toxic as hell though. You better not have any sort of opinion on anything because people will tear you apart with no remorse or logic and will turn around screaming we shouldn‚Äôt bully and call names after calling someone a racist bigot. Fun times though if your a lurker like me (someone who doesn‚Äôt post just browses)
I'd rather use the website. Honestly I gave it a try. A number of times. Resorted every single time back to the online web page.

WTH happened I understand the needing for ads but if you are implementing them to help out as far as revenue at least provide a better service than it was before. I have noticed an increasing issue with loading and getting stuck between post. I use to be able to go to the next post much faster when I first got the app when it first came out but now it takes a full minute of not more to move to the next post if it even decides to load. I‚Äôm all for ads if they allow you to provide a better service but this is getting ridiculous.

Fake notifications daily! Every day the little red circle shows up on this app although I‚Äôve turned off most notifications. I have to open the app every day to make this circle go away. However when I go to my notifications tab in the app the last notice I have is from 4 months ago.

Update has slowed app down LOOOOVE IMGUR / this app. I have never had any complaints - although read lots of other people complain in the past. This most recent update I keep having a slow / half frozen experience as I swipe from post to post, it doesn‚Äôt fully slide over it stops and makes me wait a bit.

Ad Attrition What once was a pretty decent scene is now being encroached by more ads and worse ads as they juice their community for as much money as possible. I understand that they need to make money, but this was the poorest way to monetize the platform. By making their money through advertisements, they endebt themselves to corporations instead of to their users.

Worthless app I was using the browser to scroll through Imgur but it wouldn‚Äôt allow you to recently unless you downloaded the app. So I download it and I was thoroughly enjoying it. After having it for a few weeks it‚Äôs starts to freeze; every couple minutes! It happens so frequently that it makes the app unusable.  What‚Äôs the point of an app that doesn‚Äôt work? I‚Äôve tried reinstalling, clearing out the cache, clearing data ect, and nothing works. I shouldn‚Äôt have to utilize other apps or techniques to get an app to do it‚Äôs intended purpose. I won‚Äôt be returning. Huge disappointment.

Imgur app fd up my phone I used to use imgur a lot a few years ago, came back because another site I like used it for image hosting. So I downloaded the app and omg! First off I‚Äôve NEVER had any app take that long to load!! I got suspicious of that so I deleted it before it even loaded all the way. Ever since my phone has been effed up. Everything‚Äôs loading super slow, all my sites. I‚Äôm very suspicious that malware is the first thing it loads even before the app itself and is now on my phone reporting back on every site I‚Äôm on even after deleting it. Arrrrgh!!! Don‚Äôt download it! It‚Äôs totally evil predatory crap!

Doesn‚Äôt do the one thing it was made for In the beginning, imgur was a place for Reddit users to host images and GIFs for linking on Reddit. You would upload your image, copy the link, and paste it into a Reddit post or comment. Now, there‚Äôs this whole imgur community. It has completely changed the functionality of the platform. Instead of simply uploading a picture and getting a link, they want you to give it a title, indicate a category, and post it to the imgur community. Literally all I want to do is get a direct link to my single image. I don‚Äôt want a link to an album with one image.

Can only upload posts, not images The app is tailored around social media and viral/meme posts. Every image you upload must be made part of a public posting, with a title, etc. You can‚Äôt just upload individual images to your account for sharing online, as you can with the website. Very annoying and makes the app useless to me.

Absolutely useless Only downloaded the app because they have screwed up the mobile site so badly that you can‚Äôt even log in and add photos, it‚Äôs just there to force you to get the app. So finally I caved so I could easily post from my phone and before you can sign in they force you to follow different image ‚Äútags‚Äù so you can populate your ‚Äúfeed‚Äù. And the comments on each post make viewing images frustrating. Stop trying to force people to have another annoying social media site and go back to what people actually liked about your site

App doesn't know it's on my phone Every time I find myself linked to an Imgur page, it'll say "get the app"! Yeah I already have the app. Sometimes I can't see the image because they intentionally ruin the quality so you have to have the app in order to view it. So they have this nifty button that sometimes shows up that says "view in app". Whenever I click it, it takes me to the homepage of the app where I have no hope of finding the image I was trying to look at. They just love to take me to the App Store (to download the app I already have). So go frig yourself.

Awesome! But the chat :/ I love the community. I‚Äôm mostly a lurker so I hardly ever interact or comment other than upvoting and favoriting. That being said, please please fix the chat. I love sharing posts with my friends but I really don‚Äôt like having to do it through text when my friends are on imgur as well and the imgur chat is there. Anyway, great app and great community!

Has gotten greedy with ads At first it was nice and clean with only promoted posts and a subtle ad you can ignore. Then they put another ad at the very bottom below the top comments put above the other comments so you only see them if you want to go deep in the comments. Now if you have 5 or more photos in a post they will put an ad in between those. Which means one post can have around 5 ads including the two at the bottom. This has truly ruined my experience while I know they're other apps that are way less frequent with ads.

The app itself is intuitive, the rules aren‚Äôt. The app is built very well and runs smooth on my iPhone 8+, I uploaded a collection of memes that were political and non PC (politically correct) they were removed. None of them contained nudity, merely political jokes that who ever saw had an hissy fit about. I no longer respect Imgur as a company, if I‚Äôm able to post anything like that on other image hosting sites without getting banned, and I get banned from this one. Might as well disregard this service and call it unusable, what other unpopular opinions could I post and have them deleted?

Hot garbage now Used to be a fine way to access the site. Now it‚Äôs absolute trash. Uses MASSIVE amounts of battery and data, IN THE BACKGROUND! Over the last week, 50% of my battery drain has been imgur in the background, apparently constantly loading ads to boost their revenue at the expense of your data and battery. You have to completely kill the app or expect to find your battery totally drained when you go to use your phone. The data usage is practically criminal. Apple should remove this from the store until the developers fix the behavior.  Trash trash trash.

Really cool videos and memes Sad thing is most Imgurians subscribe to group think.  Lots of emotion, very little fact.  Don‚Äôt type in ANY thought that goes against the mainstream liberal agenda...you will be bullied by all the ‚Äútolerant‚Äù voices on the left!  If it weren‚Äôt for double standards, most would have no standards at all.  With that said, I‚Äôm on all it the time.  Most of it is good clean fun.

Just plain impractical Not nearly as intuitive or community-driven as it leads you to think, unless you‚Äôre looking for something insular. I used to be a regular but I have retired because the community has gradually come to make me feel extremely uncomfortable, and also because each update gets less functional. It seems like it sacrificed image hosting quality to be more like the other social medias, but ended up losing on both. I only have this app because the website is even more impossible to use, god forbid someone send me an image.

user of 6 years finally writes a review This app has kept me company through sleepless nights, work breaks, conversation lulls, and so many other pockets of time to fill. author_name: the ro-hits just keep on coming
review_body: Great for browsing, solid for posting My only wish is that on mobile you could upload single pictures instead of albums. I use IMGUR as a host for pictures I post on Reddit, and posting single-pic albums is bad form.

Can‚Äôt upload photos No matter what I do I get errors trying to upload a photo or else it looks like it‚Äôs uploading but then nothing shows up. I could only successfully upload on the mobile website version but they removed that ability last month. Not using this service anymore until they fix the app.

Glitchy and unresponsive scrolling While scrolling my feed the view becomes unresponsive and I‚Äôm unable to stop to view a post. App also freezes frequently while ads load. Videos also load super slow for some reason, even on super fast networks. This has been going on for months and it‚Äôs clear nobody at Imgur cares to fix it or even uses their own app.
Stunning The colors, the textures, the functionality. I have to say this is a wonderful social networking application that has a lot of potential. Hope to see it shine brighter for the future!

UI is terrible. New UI scheme is really bad for navigating. If I want to head back to to the main gallery, I gotta hit that little tiny arrow up top, instead of the more natural home button location at the bottom.

New pop up adds? I‚Äôve used the app since it came out and it has gotten progressively worse. The new pop up adds after every other post have made me uninstall. We‚Äôre the adds at the bottom of each post not enough? Focus on making a quality app and supporting your community instead of squeezing a few extra bucks out of advertising.
I love everything The community, the ... Everything I love it all

Bad ad addition The mid image list ads open easily and are quite intrusive. App was working fine, but as with most organizations, instead of coming up with a decent way to monetize with ads, they chose the laziest path, at the expense of user experience. I have yet to see this be anything but a signal for an audience to jump ship before things get worse. It‚Äôs a shame, it was a decent and fun to use app.

Worse and worse with each update Seriously this used to be my favorite app but every time they release a new update their service continuously declines. It's become clearer and clearer they care much more about profit from ad revenue than any of their users and it's just disheartening to watch them change from a small caring company to yet another faceless corporation that cares nothing about us.

Imgur has a bit of a history with not being able to get ads right and I hope that this is just a phase but for now it‚Äôs 1 Star from me.

It‚Äôs great. Best app ever to escape from real life for a moment or let your legs fall asleep on the toilet. I had a meeting in the basement of their offices once, would have given it all up to go upstairs and start a new life as an admin.

Pointless notifications You get a notification everyday that has nothing to do with you or anything you posted. What‚Äôs the point? Also, when you post on a particular subject you can update that subject with new photos. Kind of low tech these days. Good point is that so far the community is good.

Improvements ‚ÄîIt Can Be Better This review is directed towards the developers of the App. I think your App is a fairly good one. My concern is in the structure of the App and the community therein. I‚Äôm using this App on a trial basis because a friend recommended it give it a try. The positive things I enjoy about the App is the easy way to share posts and interact, connect, and network with other users. However, there is not a internet etiquette structure established that does indeed insure the safety of your users not being cyber bullied and harassed while using your app. You state in your community guidelines that it is a place where your users can express themselves and connect in a safe and enjoyable environment. Within 24 hours as a new user to your app, I experienced cyber bullying, harassment, and comments  made by other users on my posts that were derogatory in nature, petty, and hostile. My replies to these individuals were always ones of respect, courtesy, candid and honest stating that although I understand this is the internet, there exists written and unwritten rules of internet decorum. I truly believed your system administrators for the app would have handled this negative behavior in an expeditious manner, yet they did not. I perceived and interpreted the reason for this is because decisions to act quickly or otherwise is subjective. While I respect the decisions to do so or not, action in matters such as the one I‚Äôve experienced so far needs improvement in my view.

Far below expectations Many problems with this app. After having another imgur app created by an individual I felt conflicted about not being loyal to the official imgur staff by not having the official imgur app. Well I've had this app for a couple of weeks and I have to say, for an official app designed by the original imgur staff it's far below my expectations. For starters it's slow and has too many bugs and it crashes frequently. I can't even view an album in the gallery without it completely reloading the post and making me start from the top. It's annoying. It doesn't fully cycle through all the images either; meaning when I get to a certain point it recycles all the same posts and I'm forced to go back to the gallery, find where I left off and restart my whole viewing process until it starts me all over again. And when I'm browsing I can not do all the things I enjoyed while using the other app. Such as zoom. I have a small little iPhone with a small little screen- so zoom is KEY. My uploads never actually upload. And I just don't like the general design and layout. The comments get jumbled and confused when I try opening them up to view replies. The other app was just way more user friendly.

Warning: Do not upload photos from Safari on iPhone 5 If you delete photos from your imgur on your computer after viewing them in this app, when you go back to the app, the photo thumbnails are still visible! Clicking the refresh arrow doesn't refresh the page. But clicking on the thumbnails returns an error that "The image you are requesting no longer exists or is no longer available." DUH!
Great way to waste time I've been an imgurian for about 2 years now and going mobile has been the best decision that I've made.

Keeps kicking me out Works great except for two things. It keeps kicking me out of the app which is really frustrating; I hate having to log in just to upvote after viewing new two images. And on top of that it keeps doing strange things with my comments. If I'm trying to post a broken up comment by replying to myself it will seem to work but later won't be able to find the comment, some will post and some won't. If I go on the computer I then find the comments in the comment section but not beneath the comment I replied to. It's very tedious to have to figure out what is and isn't actually posting where I want it to, especially when conversing with someone.

Eh, would not recommend I love Imgur and have been using it for nearly 2 years now. But, I kind of prefer just using it on safari after having tested this app. I downloaded this because first, my images weren't uploading fast and I wanted to see if it was the site and not just my silly connection, and, I was also having issues selecting pictures I wanted to place in a specific album. Neither of those were really different on this app. I can't even seem to select various pictures to delete at a time or anything I was hoping I would be able to do on here. Instead, I get re-directed to the top and have to scroll allll the way down again just to delete one. And idk if it's just that I don't know how to, but I can't seem to even make or see my albums that I can easily access on the mobile site itself. I've given up on the albums at this point lol. But yeah. Unless you somehow prefer this interface, I say that the online one has way more easily accessible features even though they're kinda glitchy while also allowing you to explore a myriad of images. It also works just as fast or slow.
Imgur is fantastic, but has one tiny flaw... The user interface is fantastic. The posts and searches load quickly, and the comments section is a breeze to use and peruse.

Ads?!  Yeah, because it's a BUSINESS! I gave 5 stars as a show of support for the business called Imgur. Got a little nauseous reading one whining reviewer after the next crying about about Imgur's "corporate greed" for having the audacity to include ads in their FREE product. Do you people not understand what a BUSINESS is?  There are actual people who keep Imgur running. This is called "having a job."  For which, one needs to "be paid."  For Imgur to be able to pay people so that you can continue to enjoy their product Imgur needs to "make a profit!"  This is called "commerce."  I suppose, everyone who is bemoaning the horrors of ads would just prefer to pay a monthly subscription fee to use Imgur?  Yeah, I thought not. People today are amazingly naive.  This is why a person like Bernie Sanders thrives. Such ignorance.

Definitely an App The Imgur app works. The data limit comment in another review is unrelated to this app. That person eats paint chips and blames Obama for natural disasters. There are small ads in a rectangular box beneath some posts. They are easily ignored and necessary to monetize the site. Anyone with a high school diploma could easily understand this basic economic concept. The Imgur community is a decentralized group of perverts, nerds and cat lovers who all seem to have a relatively dry sense of humor contrasted against a deep sense of compassion. I've only been a member for a short time, but I can mostly suggest not posting selfies, not begging for approval, not asking for money, and producing original and thought-provoking content. If this sounds like fun, I recommend the app. If not, I recommend that you continue sharing off-centered photos of overpriced Starbucks on your crappy Instagram.

I waste a lot of time Only download if you're looking to waste a lot of time and stay up late. The app runs fairly well, although sometimes it'll close or tell you the Imgur flux capacitors are, well... at capacity.

Imgurians are the best kind of people I've been on Imgur for four years, and I absolutely love the community of people. It's such a welcome change from other social media platforms in that the users and their comments are witty, funny, and inspire productive dialogue. Users are awarded upvotes (points) based on the quality of their post or comment, and earn a status with said points. The users police the content, so to speak, and trolls are simply not tolerated. If you're a jerk on Imgur you'll just be downvoted. Also selfies will get you downvoted. Original content (OC) is appreciated.

Missing a few things from browser viewing First, thank you for working so hard and listening to us. Since you are so awesome at listening to the community i am confident you will listen to suggestions.

Pretty solid. Some requests This app is beautiful and smooth and generally great. One thing I've noticed is that I don't think you can copy/save a specific image to your phone from a post. You would have to download all images which is definitely not efficient. Another thing is when you open a link in the comments to a picture, then close that picture, you go back to the top of the post. Then you have to scroll all the way back down to the comments which isn't horrible. Lastly, I feel like it doesn't have the same images as the desktop. Like the most viral new images from reddit aren't showing up or something. Anyway, those aside, this app is gorgeous and I like it a lot. Works well

Good but small issues I love this app and I go on it everyday, but there are small bugs that drive me crazy. Whenever I read a post that has a bunch of small gifs, every other gif will load. Sometimes certain posts load gifs and sometimes I wait and other posts never load. I have 3 bars of LTE and I usually get off and watch Netflix so I know my data is working. The most annoying thing though is when I scroll to look at comments, but I get stuck on the comments and every time I try to go back up the comments just reload. I always have to force close the app and start again. I give this four stars but I'll definitely give it five if the bugs can get fixed.

Imgur has jumped the shark As if the consistent degradation of the site wasn't bad enough, they apparently decided to branch out their unstable product beyond the limitations of their site getting buggier by the day. Now you have an even worse app that tries to pretend imgur is anything other than a means to an end of hosting an image. Which means the entire point is lost in a horrible ui that tries to get you to join its terrible community that posts things whenever their upload service works. That's not the end of it, no, because a nonfunctional hassle isn't enough if you can avoid it, now if you click on an imgur link, it force loads the app. Which, because it's by imgur means the coding is crap it takes forever to load and since the community aspect is forced and obnoxious, you never have the app open. Imgur used to be wonderful when it knew its place and served its purpose efficiently and well. That time has passed I guess.
Sigh Great app, and I will pop the continue to use it.....and maybe this is only because I have an older iPhone 4s.....buuut I have two major gripes about this app.

Amazazing App to Birth Time This app does not kill time. It procreates time...especially on the toilet. This app brings so much joy and inspiration in your life, it's like digital ecstasy propelling you to adopt kittens and film subway people. Wanna know how to make delicious bacon cupcakes? Yeah? Well, I guarantee you that you may, just perhaps, possibly see a how-to GIF showing you how to do just that. You'll favorite that jiffy post and never apply yourself to make your own, but you will have learned how. Also, there are puppies to boop and GIFs that loop. Why are you still reading this review? Download the app already. Or don't. My life won't be affected in any way whatever you choose. Danger Zone!

Fun yet Changed Imgur is as great as ever, though I feel like the site has migrated from either funny/happy to a more lower-tone. I do enjoy some of the more sadder stories sometimes inly because they are written well, but what I miss is Imgur's sense of ironicalness and random tomfoolery. It used to be that I could logon for five or ten minutes, get my laughs and  go. (I work for a major app company - I know how monetization works) but all i see now is people looking for clarity and for someone to back them up in their pain/ideals. For me Imgur was a place to just not give a care and just see what I havent seen. Now iys all political ( given the election {duh} i get it) but Imgur has still lost what it was created for in my opinion.
I'm a visual person... Update: Ads Update:

Just...no Slowly but surely pathetic men started taking over this app. Imgur must be run by them at this point, because nothing is done to control Imgur's now disgusting community, Every other photo on the "front page" is a nearly naked girl posed in sexual positions for people to endlessly comment what they want to do to her. There is literally so much of this trash there is an option to filter it out so you don't have a feed clogged with it. But I'm done with Imgur after the whole "NDelRey" event. Done. It proved how nasty and disgusting people can get. Imgur users were stupid enough to donate to her fake GoFundMe account, expecting her to follow through. The girl didn't make a dirty enough post for them, so she gets insulted & threatened by Imgur's most "accepted" and "popular". Just a nasty reminder of how awful people are, but unfortunately Imgur is ridden with them and does nothing to control it's community to keep awful things like that out.

Imgur This app is officially the most significant achievement in mankind's history.  It symbolizes the next step in human evolution.  Just as the farmer spelled the end for the hunter-gatherer; so, too, does imgur annihilate any and all competition as it dethrones such titans of the Internet kingdom as reddit, Facebook, and even google itself.  What possible adversary can match the server power that Imgur wields?  What social media outlet can hold games on such a massive scale as zombie infection with as much user participation?  Surely other time-wasting sites tremble and quake in fear at the mere mention of imgur's user sub!  Anyone who questions the greatness of our lord and savior, imgur, must be swiftly executed and forgotten.  There is only one power.  There is only the one.  Imgur lead us to the promised land.
Does nothing but crash now - Been using the app for a while without too much trouble till recently where it only crashes after a few minutes of use.

Fantastic app, great community. I love this app, I've had no problems using it, and since I work in a warehouse with almost no ceiling windows, it loads slow, but once outside or connected to wifi, it loads very fast.
Imgur is my favorite time waster I do enjoy the app very much. Spend time forwarding content onto friends and is always good for a laugh.

It's okay.. But I have more cons than pros The most annoying thing is the comment button not being anywhere in the post like it was before. Aren't you on your phone anyway? I used to browse imgur on the computer for hours and hours. Not only does it have current events, it's funny. If you're bored I definitely recommend browsing and it doesn't take up much space on your phone. I deleted a lot of apps after downloading but I've yet to even think about deleting this one. I haven't found any bugs on it yet and I downloaded the app a year ago when I first got my phone. Every time I'm browsing, someone asks what I'm on and they end up downloading it too. Be cautious, sometimes it gets addicting. But overall I love it!

Applause all-around Imgur itself is spectacular, of course, and this app has simply made it easier to carry all of its awesome with you at all times! I highly appreciate that it takes up so little space on my phone and it doesn't drain the battery or use up too much data. It's easy to maneuver and navigate through, and it's absolutely delightful that I can send pages to friends via text, social media, or email, depending on whether I'm sending to a friend (text) or a parent (email). I also enjoy that I can save single images and gifs to my phone with two taps. Easy, enjoyable, and all-around applaudable. üëçüèº

Enjoyable, 1 or 2 suggestions. Honestly a really well done app, much prefer it over the other apps as well as just using the mobile site. I do have one or two suggestion though, it's that when the user closes the app that when they reopen it, whenever, the app saves where they prefer to browser eg. It will open on Most Viral -> Newest instead of opening on Most Viral -> Popular all the time. Also it would be great if we could save pictures that people post as comments, currently I just screenshot but it'd be nice to have the proper image. Besides those two, I thoroughly enjoy the app.

Great app with few shortfalls Imgur has always been the user friendly option when it comes to browsing the latest Internet funnies, and this app helps make the whole process easier. They still don't have favorite folders or search by subreddit (I think), and accidentally swiping during a long post will lose your spot if you try and go back, but none of these are enough to not download the app. I wish there was a way to post reaction gifs through mobile, but again, not necessary to have fun on this app.

Terrible app; won't stop crashing Imgur has two fundamental purposes; to look at pictures, and to upload pictures. Only one of the two actually works. Let me tell you a story; I downloaded the Imgur app so I could upload some images. I created a profile, clicked on "upload" (from camera roll), and the app crashed. So I re-opened the app, clicked "upload", and the app crashed. I deleted the app, re-downloaded it, opened it, signed in, clicked "upload", and the app crashed. I googled "Imgur app upload crash", found the Imgur troubleshooting page, found advice from Imgur that restarting my device might help as it would "free up some memory". So I restarted my phone, opened the app, clicked "upload", and the app crashed. I quit. I'm done. It's not worth the frustration. Don't download this app.

Hurry get this now Do you want to see all of the things before other people see all the things? Do you want to be able to condescendingly tell your friends that you have seen the funny thing when they try to show you a funny thing? Do you want to see pictures of Michael Cera, drawn out puns, and comments that make you laugh and also feel really uncomfortable? Then hurry get this now. And prepare to spend an extra 15 minutes on the toilet, because just one more post is never just one more. Imgur is love. Imgur is life.

Listen I was introduced to this platform by a man I met on Tinder. I thought "Eh, I'll give it a go." That was my first mistake. My second error was to post cat stuff and feel the power of the Upvotes flow through my veins. It was so uplifting that I even told my mother I was officially famous. Listen closely my friends, my final blunder was to go to the desktop version. I have developed a full blown addiction for the Mlems and for booping snoots. Let us not forget of the dumps and all of the idle time wasted trolling when I should have been doing homework. This thing is a narcotic. 10/10; Would recommend.

Very good app, needs a few tweaks. The app is great if you just like to scroll through funny images now and then. However, if you're part of the imgur/Reddit community there are some shortcomings. The app does not allow messaging, notifications leave a bit to be desired, the 'source' button is something I have yet to find to bring me back to Reddit posts (this could be me missing it) and you can't seem to visit a subreddit's imgur galleries like you can on the website. (Such as r/earthporn, r/funny etc). I would definitely suggest making the app more social and working closer with Reddit. It's a very nicely made app otherwise, streamlined and entertaining.

"Image" + "Er" :) I love this app! Most of Reddit is connected to it too, which always has interesting content. I do wish it was easier to download a gif...like in 9GAG, I download it & it's automatically a video, which makes it so much easier to post on Facebook. With imgr, if I post it on FB, it's a thumbnail that opens up to a new page so people are a lot less likely to watch it. Other than that, it's great. I also wish there was a way to not see the same posts over and over again but I wish the same thing for every social media outlet.

I can't believe it's not cheese (sharp) I recently started plopping down and relaxing in life.  When I plop I love to eat cheese.  This is not a very healthy binge so my friend referred me to a substitute, Imgur.  I was immediately hooked, taking off nice shavings of gifs and memes I that never knew could taste so savory.  The community seems wonderful, witty, and funny.  I grow tired of the moldy freezer burn aftertaste of other cheese substitute communities, full of negativity and foul mouth nastiness.  Imgur is refreshing and has saved me from becoming obese from cheesy nightmares.  Thanks Imgur I'll always love you my sweet street boy.

The Best Method I've Found For Wasting Time Imgur sets the gold standard for it use of user submitted content and the online community it creates.  New content floods imgur at an alarming pace.  This ensures you are never far from being absorbed into new content.  This also allows someone to flex their creative mind muscle and shamelessly attempt to earn fake Internet points.  While the points are infantile and meaningless to the rest of the world; you will soon find yourself selling your soul for the possible up votes gained from comments.  Imgur is a true masterpiece for social media.

Imgur As you can see I rated Imgur a perfect 5/7. Besides no favorite folders or messaging in the app. Basically if you want to seem funny on facebook, look through this and post things from it, BUT NOT THE OTHER WAY AROUND, IF ITS BEEN ON FACEBOOK WE HAVE SEEN IT ALREADY, but seriously get the app, I'm serious, get it, do it, click install, come on, if you have Touch ID you don't even have to type in your password, it'll literally be touching your phone twice, seriously download it, for real, it'll change the way you see your morning dumps, no joke...

Good, but still needs work I'm very glad to finally see the official Imgur app in the App Store, but I'm a little disappointed in some of the app's feature. Most notably, I can't access the share options for GIFs from album view, only from my images page. I have a lot of GIFs in my account that I like to share in various places, and it's difficult to do so when I can't access the sharing links from my albums. Sharing works fine for photos - just tap the image - but not for GIFs.

Needs an overhaul Being that this is the only app that allows you to check your notifications, you should do something with push notifications, badges, alerts, etc. The message screen itself is all kinds of messed up. The box to reply is floating above the keyboard and you have to click two or more times in the box to just type. All of that being said, the gallery is a completely different beast. The app freezes randomly, switches from user sub to viral every time I try to back out of an image, doesn't submit comments all the time and crashes every 15 minutes. The only reason I still use this app is because I can only chat with my Imgur friends on this app. It's quite difficult to use.

Nope. I notice there are posts on the desktop version that aren't on the app. I can't miss any posts! I might miss an inside joke being born. Also I can't see my comment as I'm typing it, which means I can't paste in a link. I don't like the almost-dark-grey used in the color scheme, it's not super easy on the eyes. Navigation is kind of an annoyance. Have to scroll to the top of a post to get back to the front page. There's no messaging. There are people I only talk to through imgur, so messaging is important. Everything defaults to most popular instead of most recent and I have to change it back every time I open the app. Spent a long time waiting for this app, gotta say, I'm disappointed.

Community makes it worth it I love imgur, I say this because of it's community... Now most people would be confused reading this, however, the community on imgur is not like any other. If any one has used ifunny, Reddit, or any other image/gif app, they already know the countless, lovely hours you can spend on it.. Imgur is a whole different breed. Anything you see on Facebook, has been here first, it's like the underground community, there are inside jokes galore, and the more time you spend on it the more you understand it. Imgur is awesome!!
A Blurred Concept I absolutely love the new design. Flat, simple, elegant, new; yet so familiar.
Won some, lost some The app seems more stable, but I really do not like the new look. The previous interface was much better in just about every way. Here are a few, just to name a few:

5/5 ui design Fantastic app with very bright and intuitive design. The color scheme really gives this app a pop effect. I enjoy viewing images that are shared on the Internet in the best quality possible and this allows it. Active community with funny memes, as well as personal life moments and stories, with pictures for perspective. You'll find anything on this app from funny memes to high quality wallpapers for your mobile/desktop. Overall, great time killer if you're sitting in a office waiting for an appointment.

The best parts of all social media in one Take the pictures, gifs, and videos from Instagram. Add the "front page" concept which shows the best posts, and allow the rating/upvoting/liking of comments on those posts so the best are at the top. Then allow threads of comments where you can reply to specific comments like Reddit. Then include the fact that most of the content is original. Lastly, it has a group feeling, where people will reference older posts, giving it an insider feeling. It's truly great.

Only Review? Am I seriously the only person to review this after the update? Eh-herm... Anyway, the app is pretty good, I can easily upload images and add descriptions and stuff like that. The categories are easy to get to and, if your Internet is quick, the posts load very smoothly and immediately

Its just the best Imgur (pronounced exactly how it looks, IMM-gur) is centered around images from around the world and all walks of life. Comics, funny stuff, serious stuff, pictorial DIYs, GIFs... you name it, Imgur has it. Addicting as hell and it can be experienced in many ways, there are so many facets to this amazing community. For light browsing of popular material, start with front-page stuff. You can search for specific tags or view unlimited Random mode. And for the brave of heart and strong of stomach - there's always User-sub... but I didn't send you there.

Hate the new version Granted I have an iPad instead of iPhone, but anybody making mobile apps today should know you have to work on both platforms. I have given this new app a few tries, but have to ditch it completely. There seems to be some sort of sizing/resolution problem. The images frequently get cut off on the right side of the screen and if you pinch to zoom in/out it will show you the correct width, but then you can't scroll up/down to see everything.  The comments are large enough for my almost blind grandfather to read; I guess that's for iPhone.  Honestly, the layout of the old app was far superior, but it had crashing issues. I am using imgur less and less  since the update of this app.
Uh, comments are cut o Off. They're cut off.

Works...sometimes About 50% of the time, the app loads nothing when started, so I have to close the app and try again until it does. When it does, gifs within posts load VERY slowly, but gifs in comments load with no issues in a quick manner (?). Occasionally the app will crash when in the middle of a long post which gets frustrating. Also, would be nice to be able to post from mobile, like other non-official imgur apps allow you to do. Otherwise, the overall layout of the app is simple and easy to use, it's just got some bugs that need attention!

Why no Imgur, I hadn't planned on doing anything with my day... What's that Imgur? A cute cat video?! Ooooo, look at the kitty. It thinks it's people. Hehe. PettyOfficer117 made a new Gif? Definitely need to check that out. Hahaha, I know what Razor1000 would have to say about that. I'm sorry mister phone, your battery is dying you say? But I just charged you, and I have only been on Imgur for a few minutes... Mister phone? Why are you saying that it's morning? Scoff! Silly phone, if it were morning....oh...the sun is up. This really needs to stop happening.

Significantly Improved but still has minor issues The app has significantly improved over last updates and no longer crashes. The main remaining problems are sometimes pages will freeze/stall and not load or the app will have to be restarted because it's not loading anything (primarily when losing and reconnecting to WiFi). Also, the app still does not support messaging and there are not folders for favorites. Still far better and more reliable than using your mobile browser.
Simple done correctly This is one of the best apps I've had the pleasure of using.

Very nice! Imgur (definitely pronounced imm-jerr) is a great service. It provides a platform to share cool stuff, news, and stories. The service itself isn't frustrating, is easy to use, and is not complicated. There might be some questionable content on the "front page" or "most viral" sometimes, but it's not usually a problem and people will post what they will, it's not really on the service to police what goes on there. Top marks, Imgur. Now only if we could get that second server :).

Too Much Time I had a surplus of time. I was idle and they say that idle hands are the devil's hands. They're true. Whoever they are knew that with my surplus of time I would commit atrocities. I would do chores. I would cook food. I would even work for more than 8 hours a day.

Why aren't more people using this?! This app is hysterical, it's like ifunny and Reddit had a kid. It's also very powerful, a source for many people to receive advice and support through whatever challenges and struggles they may face. Aside from that, it's inspiring. Images describing the story of a broke college student who traveled the world, recaps of all the positive things going on in the world and tons of funny animal videos. If you're bored and looking to kill some time and even learn something, download this app. #rindgetinge

Some truth bombs This apps great. The community is unique with more inside jokes and special occasions then i have seen on any other sites. The content refreshes quickly and has generally good pictures(with some exceptions). My only warning about imgur is that its easy for it to become a habit. Its easily the number one app i use but sometimes i find myself going through the motions. I often close out of it and by force of habit i reopen the app immediately. I have seen everything and nothing makes me laugh anymore. Overall, eh not bad 4/5.

So frustrating... I love Imgur, but this app is so frustrating I quit using it. My chief complaint is that it does this weird "refresh."  Expand out photos to see beyond 10 in the gallery seems to work fine, go beyond 20 and sometimes the page reloads. When it happens I can never expand out further. In other cases it will refresh back to the first image even though I haven't touched the screen.
Annoying Can't comment more than a few words before you can't read what is being typed.

Lacks significant functionality You can't upload content with this app. Imgur's content is 100% user generated, so why release an app that doesn't let end users generate content? It'd be lovely if imgur were just something you only browsed and commented on, like a news site or blog. But honestly, it feels like a social media app where you can't post anything of your own.

Don't do it, unless it's too late for you I'm making plea to you to not get involved in this...thing.  If you have any need in your life to be productive or have loved ones that need attention, do not download.  This addiction is a crippling disease.  It's a compulsion that goes beyond mere drive. I'm serious. You think you'll be different, that you don't even like cat pictures, or posts about Neil deGrass Tyson. But you're wrong, you're so wrong.

Some problems need addressing... I'm as addicted to Imgur as the next guy over but- this version is pretty broken. It still works decent, but when tapping into a post when someone replies to your comment, it crashes. Every. Single. Time.

Love imgur.. But. the comments... Honestly I really do, Only thing I think I'd change if I had to..The comments. I hate that you only get a few lines in and then your cut off until you reply to your original comment. If you have a lot to say, your putting up like 4 or 5 replies to the original comment and sometimes the replies/comments magically disappear, making you go through that whole grueling process all over again. Other than the comments portion... I love it..

I really like it The new improvements to the app really really took me by surprise I do not regret re downloading it after how bad it used to be. Love the up its animation or when you look at a comment link the animation of you flicking away the gif is so smooth. And the snap of going from image to image is great. Can't speak any better about the new app. Now all we need is folders in our favorites and maybe less downtime on the servers and it would literally be perfect
This is my life now I used to be a man of great thought and providence.  I would frequently ponder the greatest questions man has imagined.  Now I ponder a way to make it to front page.

<3 I've always preferred imgur over Reddit and imgur has finally listened to mobile users complaints and suggestions and did virtually a complete overhaul of the app. It's very user friendly and the new feature to comment gifs instead of links is my favorite new thing to do. The community is all around a good place to interact with, always have your few poppyheads. If you love to do anything except that you're supposed to be doing, imgur is the place for you!

Overall awesome! Love Imgur and the mobile app makes it super easy to browse, comment and favorite posts and images. In many ways it rivals the desktop version or beats it outright. Would definitely recommend it if you use Imgur already and if you don't you should. It's a good place to laugh, learn and think about something new everyday. It's also a global community so you can get perspectives on things far beyond your own and see and read thing here you probably won't most other places.

Still has nothing on Pocketgur It's still painful to use when I compare it the the more elegant Pocketgur.  There are no tags and the thumbnail view isn't there.  The slightly zoomed out scrolling view is awkward, and it takes room any step to try to zoom into an image.  Also, the controls are awkward when scrolling down into the comments.  I really gave this new update a shot, but it hasn't won me over yet.  Pocketgur still ftw.

Great if you have fast internet This app might be great if you have fast internet, but if you don't it is terrible!  On the webpage if a post has multiple gifs only the first one loads and you can load them one at a time. This allows you to skip the ones you've seen a million times or you can see are uninteresting. Or even better read the one line of text on each gif without bothering to load it.

Please bring back search and favorites I'm happy with the visual updates and simplified UI, but losing the ability to view my favorites and search is a big step backwards. I access Imgur on my iPhone about 90% of the time and relied on those features quite a bit.

I've haven't had a problem. Except one. Now, I browse Imgur a lot. I usually don't have problems at all. Sure it crashes sometimes but what app doesn't. I see people complain about gifs taking too long to load. I actually never have a problem. The only problem I have and why I didn't rate a perfect 5 stars is because I would like the Imgur team to allow personal messaging through the app. I don't get notified about the messages I have and I have to log on through a web browser.

What have I done? I use to have a job, a wife, two kids, a nice car, a decent house, but not anymore. This app swallowed my productive life whole! But on the plus side, I've become an inventor; I've had to create several machines help me stay on this app at all time, because if I were to leave for one second, I fear I may slip back to reality, and I have no life there anymore. I am an imgurian. I will never know a home such as this beyond this app! I'm happy, I swear. All hail hypnotoad!

5/7 Would Meme Again Imgur is an amazing community with an even better app. The ever evolving jokes that seemingly change every week, the good old front page that constantly updates, is what makes this app worth using. Its most certainly better than iFunny and its lousy 60 features per day! Thus, as the current meme on imgur goes around, i would give this a whooping 5/7 which translates to a 10/10 for any non imgur users!

Kinda nice? Overall the update is cool, except for the fact that all the buttons are at the top of the dang screen. So, all big phone users? Forget favoriting, or downvoting (you can still upvote with that neat new double tap ooooooh). Also, you can no longer pull down to go back to the grid, but they added a nice new button on the bottom menu bar (seriously guys why the moving buttons around) since it was useless at the top. But! But. Now I have a search option on my bottom bar instead (oooooh) and can no longer see how many photos are in an album, or if a post has a gif or a photo (goodbye data).
One Major Issue imgur is great. I'm on Reddit a lot, so I in turn end up on imgur a lot.

Favorites folders? Please?! love,love,LOVE Imgur + the app. Only thing I wish we were able to do is sort our favorites. You know how stupid I look when I try and show somebody something hilarious from two months ago and I'm scrolling for hours in my favorites. You guys make all these new awesome adjustments all the time... just kindly give us folders for our favorites, be able to favorite comments.. and longer comments, wouldn't hurt.. but not necessary.

It's Very Good Sometimes I find myself wandering about in the landscape of that beast known as the Internet, and now everything that I have loved about Memes, dank as they may be, and also dangerous as they may be, is in one particular condensed and beautifully organized space called Imgur. I love this app, and I love the community of wild knucklehead users that comes free with it.

Please fix! Was working great for me but after the updates, browsing has gotten bad. If I scroll down and select a pic then decide to go back, it automatically scrolls to the very top of the image list, and I lose the spot I was at. When I select browse by newest, scroll down, select and image, then go back, I am no longer in the newest category but back in the popular category and scrolled to the top of the list.

Orgasmic Everything is perfect. Been scrolling steadily through user sub since I first got the app and I haven't hit an infinite loop yet, and I'm hoping there won't be one. The way you can view reactionary gifs and all the other stuff that you normally would in the comments is amazing. I still haven't experimented with being able to post a reactionary gif in the comments but I'm excited!! I'm really excited for this!!!

Great app. I just have a suggestion There are times when I spend literally 30+ minutes viewing all the images and then I leave the app, come back to it a while later and I find my self having to start over from the top. It would be nice if I could stay on the last viewed image I made and when the time came, I could just refresh and find my self viewing tons of fresh new stuff.

Great app for an awesome site! While one could call time spent of the imgur app a time waste, I seem to learn something every time I'm on it, in between laughing and sometimes shedding a few tears. The comments are often better than the posts and the community is, for the most part, encouraging and caring when needed by posters. Love imgur and love the app. Make the most of it and open an account so you can vote and maybe post as well.

Decent update Look and feel overall is good.  Text seems to pop more and it's cleaner overall.  Really annoying thing though is navigating to the comments on a long post.  Previously you could just pull up a bit and half the comments bar would show, allowing you to tap and jump to it (not the most elegant but hey it worked).  Now I'm having to swipe like crazy if I just want to see/add a comment, and of course I blow right past the start if I'm going too fast.  A comments button on the top would be nice.

Album View In Uploads Section Viewing an album works great when looking under the favorites section. However, when under the uploads section there is no way to see only albums that I have created for my own content. It currently groups albums with all other images that are in those albums making it difficult to fine the actual album. This is the only thing stopping me from giving a five star rating.

Great app- downloaded after Reddit frustration. Downloaded imgur after getting really frustrated with all the garbage Reddit apps that never seemed to work well with my iPad and had a bad layout. Been using imgur for a couple of weeks now and so far no issues. The app runs smoothly and has a nice swipe right feature which is a refreshing idea after coming from reddits open and close system of links.

Imgur got it right It's taken time and a number of revisions of this app but Imgur has really put out an awesome product. You can tell their development team has really focused on making a good fun mobile experience that's easy to use. If you're unfamiliar with the site it's absolutely incredible, the content is great but honestly the best part is the other users commenting. I really love the folders for your favorites. -DJGnarly

Happy Mobile User I often use imgur to unwind during/after a stressful day at work and I'm extremely happy with the current version of this app! It's very reliable (I.e. Doesn't crash or sign me out all the time), easy to navigate, and the quality of the content is great! Also, I've never been told by anyone in the real world that I was idolized, have you?! Therefore, fake internet points > real friends üëçüèΩ

Great App I've been an Imgur user for more than 4 years now and I've never had any issues. Yes, they do change things here and there every once in a while but it's not a big deal. I didn't care when they changed the colors of the buttons or the other things. The stories, posts, and sense of community keeps me coming back every day! That's what matters and I think it's worth getting the app ;) üçåüéÆüëæ

Needs fixing At the moment the app has a lot of issues loading large groups of images and will get stuck loading them. (Magic circle of death) this makes it difficult to browse smoothly and forces me to either skip it or go to the desktop version. I've also noticed that iy will sometimes be perpetually in the background.

Bad Update This is now the second update that's been not so good for mobile users. The first one was more annoying because the app would just freeze and crash. Now I can't even get the app to open and go to a screen. I just touch the app, it goes to a new screen for a split second and then shuts me out and takes me back to my phone home page. A little ridiculous at this point.

Missing features could improve. It doesn't have any way to save any of the images on iPhone other than screenshots. Interface is ok at best, not sure how I feel about the sliding vs thumbnail overview.

I love imgur! This is an entertaining app, yes, but, more than that, it's a community, or, perhaps more nearly, a family. Like all families, there are things that go on that I don't necessarily agree with (from other user's comments, for instance), but I appreciate the sense of community, the laughs, the perspectives which shape my own, and the good works that we do together as an imgur family. Now, if we could only agree on how to pronounce "imgur!" -ThoreauItUp22
